data.meta_description: Last summer's joy of growing chili peppers inspired me to find a way to continue it throughout winter. I built an indoor greenhouse that autonomously maintains…
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Last summer's joy of growing chili peppers inspired me to find a way to continue it throughout winter. I built an indoor greenhouse that autonomously maintains the ideal climate for chili plants, including heat, humidity, and ventilation, with a day-night cycle. Navigating the system design cycle from idea to reality was immensely satisfying. Now, in early April, a chili plant that would only survive in climates such as Namibia's is about to bloom.
